extendedIngredients.name: baby spinach
extendedIngredients.original: 3/4 pound baby spinach or tatsoi (4 packed cups)
extendedIngredients.originalName: 3/4 pound baby spinach or tatsoi (4 packed cups)

extendedIngredients.name: cashews
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup coarsely chopped toasted unsalted cashews

extendedIngredients.name: squid
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 pounds cleaned small squid, bodies sliced crosswise into 1/3-inch rings
extendedIngredients.originalName: cleaned small squid, bodies sliced crosswise into 1/3-inch rings

extendedIngredients.name: sriracha chili sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 2 tablespoons Sriracha chili sauce or other hot chili sauce
extendedIngredients.originalName: Sriracha chili sauce or other hot chili sauce

title: Wok-Charred Squid Salad with Baby Spinach and Cashews
summary: Wok-Charred Squid Salad with Baby Spinach and Cashews is a gluten free, dairy free, whole 30, and pescatarian recipe with 6 servings. One serving contains 273 calories, 20g of protein, and 18g of fat. For $2.75 per serving, this recipe covers 25% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Head to the store and pick up baby spinach, sriracha chili sauce, cashews, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the salt you could follow this main course with the Apple Turnovers Recipe as a dessert. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. It works well as a main course. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 68%. This score is solid. Try Thai Charred Squid (Pla Muek Yang), Charred Squid Skewers on Garlic Toast with Arugula, and Spinach Salad With Bacon and Cashews for similar recipes.
instructions: Arrange the baby spinach and endive spears in 6 individual salad bowls.                                               In a medium bowl, toss the squid with the mint, cilantro, toasted cashews and chili sauce and season with salt.                                               Heat a wok or skillet until hot. Add 1 tablespoon of oil and, when it begins to smoke, add one-third of the squid. Stir-fry over high heat for 10 seconds. Deglaze the skillet with 1 tablespoon of the lime juice and spoon the squid into 2 of the bowls. Repeat 2 more times with the remaining squid. Serve the salad at once, with the lime wedges.

steps.step: Arrange the baby spinach and endive spears in 6 individual salad bowls.
In a medium bowl, toss the squid with the mint, cilantro, toasted cashews and chili sauce and season with salt.
Heat a wok or skillet until hot.

Add 1 tablespoon of oil and, when it begins to smoke, add one-third of the squid. Stir-fry over high heat for 10 seconds. Deglaze the skillet with 1 tablespoon of the lime juice and spoon the squid into 2 of the bowls. Repeat 2 more times with the remaining squid.
Serve the salad at once, with the lime wedges.
